intro: Psychotria carolinensis, commonly known as the Carolina wild pepper, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are elliptic to ovate, with a smooth texture and a distinctive dark green color. The flowers are small, white, and clustered in cymes, often appearing in late spring to early summer.
